sn1.25:1.1: Katāvī (“proficient”) is also found at MN 82:38.5.
sn1.25:1.4: The questioner wonders how those who have abandoned the conceit of self could use the word “I”.
sn1.25:2.6: An “expression” (vohāra) is a “conveyance” for sharing meaning. It does not implicate the user in a metaphysical view of “Self”. See DN 9:53.5.
